intro: Spermacoce brachystema subvar. tryonii, commonly known as the slender false mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. The species is characterized by its slender stem and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
